texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: It's not abnormal for qmail act oddly at times with Plesk, and sometimes it can use 100% of the CPU. However, if you find qmail's load to be higher than usual with a small volume of mail, there may be a fix that you need.
texts.text: It's not abnormal for qmail act oddly at times with Plesk, and sometimes it can use 100% of the CPU. However, if you find qmail's load to be higher than usual with a small volume of mail, there may be a fix that you need.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: First off, check for two files in  /var/qmail/control  called  dh512.pem  and  dh1024.pem . If they are present, well, then this article won't be able to help you. You have a different issue that is causing increased CPU load (check for swap usage and upgrade your disk's speed).
texts.text: First off, check for two files in  /var/qmail/control  called  dh512.pem  and  dh1024.pem . If they are present, well, then this article won't be able to help you. You have a different issue that is causing increased CPU load (check for swap usage and upgrade your disk's speed).

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If the files aren't there, do the following:
texts.text: If the files aren't there, do the following:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# cd /var/qmail/control
# cp dhparam512.pem dh512.pem
# cp dhparam1024.pem dh1024.pem
# /etc/init.d/qmail restart
# /etc/init.d/xinetd restart
texts.text:
# cd /var/qmail/control
# cp dhparam512.pem dh512.pem
# cp dhparam1024.pem dh1024.pem
# /etc/init.d/qmail restart
# /etc/init.d/xinetd restart

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: At this point, your CPU load should be reduced once the currently running processes for qmail clear out.
texts.text: At this point, your CPU load should be reduced once the currently running processes for qmail clear out.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: So why is this fix required? Without dh512.pem and dh1024.pem, qmail has to create certificate and key pairs when other mail servers or mail users connect to qmail via TLS. If qmail is forced to generate them on the fly, you will get a big performance hit, and your load will be much higher than it could be. By copying the dhparam files over, you will pre-populate the SSL key and certificate for qmail to use, and all it has to do is pick it up off the file system rather than regenerating it each time.
texts.text: So why is this fix required? Without dh512.pem and dh1024.pem, qmail has to create certificate and key pairs when other mail servers or mail users connect to qmail via TLS. If qmail is forced to generate them on the fly, you will get a big performance hit, and your load will be much higher than it could be. By copying the dhparam files over, you will pre-populate the SSL key and certificate for qmail to use, and all it has to do is pick it up off the file system rather than regenerating it each time.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: SWsoft Forums: Qmail-smtpd spawning many processes, using full cpu
texts.text: SWsoft Forums: Qmail-smtpd spawning many processes, using full cpu
